title.english: Sword of the Demon Hunter: Kijin Gentosho

description:
In the Edo period, there was a shrine maiden called "Itsukihime" in the mountain village of Kadono. Jinta, a young man who acts as the shrine maiden's guardian despite being a stranger, encounters a mysterious demon who speaks of the far future in the forest where he went to defeat it. From Edo to the Heisei era, this huge Japanese fantasy series follows a demon man who travels through time while continuously questioning the meaning of wielding a sword.

(Source: Crunchyroll News, edited)

Notes:
• The first episode has a runtime of ~1 hour.
synonyms: Sword of the Demon Hunter: Kijin Gentosho

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Shrine Maiden
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a shrine maiden.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Arranged Marriage
tags.description: Features two characters made to marry each other, usually by their family.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

node.description:
__[Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/takada.html)__

__Ryuuichi Takada__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and member of music unit MONACA. He mainly composes and arranges for videogames, having worked on the soundtracks for Soul Calibur, Tekken, Katamari Damacy, and The iDOLM@STER.

[Website](http://hitodama.info/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitodama1103/)

A Japanese singer, songwriter, radio personality and scriptwriter.

She has released 17 singles and 11 albums since her debut as a 13-year-old in 1994. Several of her songs have been used as anime theme songs. She is often mistaken for a voice actress because she is in the same field of activity as idol-esque voice actresses. When she is working as a screenwriter, she goes by the name Deko Akao, an alias made up from her senior [Satoru Akahori](https://anilist.co/staff/97460/)'s name.

Mother of a son and twin daughters.

__[Artist Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/hirokawa.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kayone87)__

__Keiichi Hirokawa__ is a Japanese music composer and arranger who belongs to sound production studio MONACA.

[Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/takahashi.html)

Japanese composer and arranger working for music production company MONACA since 2013. He is a graduate of Hokkaido University of Education.

__[Website](https://hilcrhyme.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Hilcrhyme2011)__

__Formed:__ 2006, Niigata Prefecture, Japan

__Introduction:__
Hilcrhyme is a Japanese former duo, now solo unit under record label Universal Music Artists (2019–), having previously been under Universal (2009–2017) and Jingumae Records (2018). They were affiliated with the entertainment company Naoplan Co., Ltd (2008–2017), and is currently affiliated with Universal Music Artists (2017–).

The name "Hilcrhyme" originates from a pun on the Japanese pronounciation of hillclimb and rhyme.

__Member:__
- [TOC](https://anilist.co/staff/180186) (トク) – vocalist, rapper and in-charge of lyrics and composition

__Former Member:__
- DJ KATSU (ディージェーカツ) – DJ, in-charge of composition and arrangement.
Formerly affiliated with [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/AIC), currently working at [Senju Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/7581/Senju-Kobo).

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.
The CEO of Yokohama Animation Lab
